title: Yokihi = Princess Yang Kwei Fei
creator_contributor_role: Daiei Motion Picture Company, production company
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/China - Politics and government
abstract: Note: Based on a poem 'Period of long lament' by Pai Lo-Tien.
description: The Chinese Emperor Genso of the Tang Dynast marries a beautiful scullery maid on the death of his wife, with whom he falls in love. The new empress is destroyed by jealousies and intrigue around her as a popular revolt rises against the couple. This film uses an exquisite colour range with costumes and decor to relay the characters' emotional turmoil. A film about political intrigue and corruption in 8th century China, 'Princess Yang Kwei Fei' depicts the dying stages of a dynasty. In the film's final scenes the Emperor, who has survived the uprising but is old and unhappy, is mystically reunited with his deceased wife.  Credits: Producer, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoda Yoshikata, Matsutaro Kawaguchi, Masashige Narusawa, Tao Jin ; photography, Kohei Sugiyama ; music, Hayasaka Fumio. Cast: Machiko Kyo, Masayuki Mori, So Yamamura, Eitaro Ozawa, Eitaro Shindo, Haruko Sugimura.
